content.location: Left end of White Wall, right of Aku Aku

climbs.name: Short People Need Not Apply
climbs.fa: Alex A,  Peter Cleveland, Paul Jones

content.description:
On the right side of the white wall there's a V slot/deep crack just left of the corner, climb slot/crack to overhang then up face crux, 5.12c lunge/deadpoint,  finish on upper face,

 Note on FA, I did the FA with Peter Cleveland, and a year later Peter C, broke a hold, and changed it from 12a to 12c and now requires lunge/deadpoint, Paul Jones was the 1st to do it with the missing hold,
content.location: about 10 12ft right of Purple Strip and left around corner from Exit Blues

content.description: Climb up the set-back to the ledge, or climb a crack on the right and hand-traverse left to the ledge (more contrived, but more fun moves).  Step up on a decent foothold out on the face, and work your way through a serious of strenuous small holds up the seam to the top.  Clever footwork pays dividends here.
content.protection:
Gear to 2" for the lower part.  Gear from 1/8 - 1/2" at the crux.  It's actually possible to get 3-4 pieces in, if you have enough small gear and the patience to hang out and place it. 

  Although there is gear, it requires precision to place it well, so I'd still call this route PG13.
content.location: The main portion of White Wall hosts a couple of 12's, and "Purple Stripe."  On the left side of this sweep of rock is a square cut set-back with a ledge/alcove on its right.

climbs.name: Exit Blues
climbs.fa: FTR: Alex A, Peter Cleveland, FL: Eggert?

content.description: Climb corner and face to overhang with crux crack above
content.location: Right around the corner from Short People Need Not Apply,

content.description:
Scramble up on top of the pedestal-like block. Tip-toe up and make a committed bounce for the big ledge up and left - this will be very reachy if you are short.  Continue up big, flat holds to the horizontal seam and reach the crack that comes in on the right for your first gear.  Continue up the crack, harder than it looks, to the top. 

  An alternate start is to follow the crack that comes in from the right!
content.location: Right of "Unsatisfactorily", the blank face above the pedestal-like block.

content.description: Climb consists of 2 small corners stacked up on one another with a rest at the 1/2 way point.  Bottom corner is really nice stemming and small holds in the corner and out right within reach.  If you use the left rib holds and edges it is a bit easier but it doesn't add any security to a lead attempt.  The upper corner is steep and straight in but also has edges to utilize.
content.protection: Skinny and barely there in the first corner.  Smallest TCU or Zero, Ballnuts.  Upper corner has great pro in the medium sized cams and stoppers.
content.location: Corner system between routes "Unsatisfactorily" to the left and "Easter Island" to the right in the middle of the White Wall.

content.description: A series of high steps and side pulls.  On the upper part of the tower you have a choice of either using the left edge or the right edge (easier).
content.protection: Some gear in the horizontal seams.
content.location: On the tower at the left-hand end of White Wall.

content.description: Starts in shallow dihedral to flake, then up and right on face, just right of Purple Strip, shares the upper part of Short People need not apply,
content.location: Between Purple Strip and Short People Need Not

pathTokens: East Bluff 03 - West of the Quarry

content.description: Another piece of the West Terraces.  A small rock with 4-5 worthwhile routes.
